body: Is there any chance you could use git bisect to find the commit which broke this?
Let me try to reproduce this on Windows 8.1 with https://filezilla-project.org/download.php?type=server

> How can I help to debug this issue?

Please provide your remote config with secrets redacted

Here is my testbed:
- Windows 8.1 Pro
- FileZilla server latest on internal IP address, one test user with password
- DNS record for that IP
- LetsEncrypt certificate
- rclone 1.52.3, 1.53.0, 1.53.4, 1.54.1, 1.55.0

rclone config:
```
[ftps]
type = ftp
host = testhost.xxx
user = ftpuser1
pass = xxx
tls = false
explicit_tls = true
```

Results of running various rclone clients:
```
2021/04/05 15:06:41 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.52.3" starting with parameters ["C:\\bin\\rclone-1.52.3.exe" "ls" "-vv" "ftps:dir"]
2021/04/05 15:06:41 DEBUG : Using config file from "C:\\Users\\ivandeex\\.config\\rclone\\rclone.conf"
2021/04/05 15:06:41 DEBUG : ftp://testhost.xxx:21/dir: Connecting to FTP server
    17408 Thumbs.db
   133341 kitty.jpg
2021/04/05 15:06:41 DEBUG : 2 go routines active

2021/04/05 15:06:47 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.53.0" starting with parameters ["C:\\bin\\rclone-1.53.0.exe" "ls" "-vv" "ftps:dir"]
2021/04/05 15:06:47 DEBUG : Using config file from "C:\\Users\\ivandeex\\.config\\rclone\\rclone.conf"
2021/04/05 15:06:47 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "ftps:dir"
2021/04/05 15:06:47 DEBUG : ftp://testhost.xxx:21/dir: Connecting to FTP server
2021/04/05 15:06:47 ERROR : : error listing: directory not found
2021/04/05 15:06:47 DEBUG : 2 go routines active
2021/04/05 15:06:47 Failed to ls with 2 errors: last error was: directory not found

2021/04/05 15:06:54 DEBUG : Using config file from "C:\\Users\\ivandeex\\.config\\rclone\\rclone.conf"
2021/04/05 15:06:54 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.55.0" starting with parameters ["C:\\bin\\rclone-1.55.0.exe" "ls" "-vv" "ftps:dir"]
2021/04/05 15:06:54 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "ftps:dir"
2021/04/05 15:06:54 DEBUG : ftp://testhost.xxx:21/dir: Connecting to FTP server
2021/04/05 15:06:54 ERROR : : error listing: directory not found
2021/04/05 15:06:54 DEBUG : 2 go routines active
2021/04/05 15:06:54 Failed to ls with 2 errors: last error was: directory not found
```

1.52.3 lists directory correctly
1.53.0 and later fail on TLS

Server output for 1.52.3 (all works):

rclone version output for tested binaries:
```
rclone v1.52.3
- os/arch: windows/amd64
- go version: go1.14.7

rclone v1.53.0
- os/arch: windows/amd64
- go version: go1.15

rclone v1.55.0
- os/type: windows
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.16.2
- go/linking: dynamic
- go/tags: cmount
```

Conclusion:
Something has changed with TLS handling in the Go standard library between go 1.14.7 and 1.15

EDIT: I tried rclone 1.55 built with go 1.13, it failed. Will dig further.

EDIT2: I tested explicit TLS (it can be fixed by https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/5210#issuecomment-813554177) but user's problem was with `implicit` TLS.  Please forget this comment.

Hi @ncw. I'm afraid that's far beyond my knowledge. I could try to learn how to use git bisect, but this is going to take some time.

Regarding @ivandeex testbed, thanks for taking your time to check this. However, your rclone remote config shows `type = ftp` and  `explicit_tls = true`, which means you are using FTPES (FTP over **explicit** TLS), but my setup is using FTPS (FTP over **implicit** TLS). Maybe, that's why your report shows different rclone versions (implicit was working for me up to v1.54.1) failing?

> However, your rclone remote config shows `type = ftp` and `explicit_tls = true`, .....

Just send here your redacted config.

Here you are:

```
[ftps_remote]
type = ftp
host = MY_IP
user = username
port = MY_PORT
pass = *** ENCRYPTED ***
tls = true
```

According to this thread: https://forum.filezilla-project.org/viewtopic.php?t=36903

This should fix the problem in the FileZilla server

> just un-tick
> "Require TLS session resumption on data connection..."

Here is a relevant issue in the FTP library rclone uses: https://github.com/jlaffaye/ftp/issues/203

Thanks for sharing your finding @ncw, but my FileZilla Server has (and had when I opened this issue) that option unselected.

I've seen that the FTP library issue you mention appears as closed from Dec 3, 2020. Should we reopen it, or would it perhaps be better to open a new one?

Doing bisection among only those commits that changed `backend/ftp/...` I found:
- guilty commit: https://github.com/rclone/rclone/commit/edfe183ba2f95120062596c98f23fe91e615b6f7
- guilty PR: https://github.com/rclone/rclone/pull/4266
- quick fix (reverts guilty commit for backend/ftp/...): https://github.com/ivandeex/rclone/commit/fd7bad259607b97a8afa5a7ffa2519dff1da6e98

@aliron19
Please try this beta: [ivandeex/rclone@v1.55.0-ftpx01](https://github.com/ivandeex/rclone/releases/tag/v1.55.0-ftpx01)
It works for me with a config similar to yours.

@ncw
Tomorrow I will dig what was wrong with that PR. Most probably, a wrong rebase.
Great digging @ivandeex  A faulty rebase seems likely. I seem to remember fixing one for that commit already.
@ivandeex if we can get a fix for this in the next day or two I'd like to put it in a 1.55.1 to go out with the sftp fix.

@ivandeex 
I'm pleased to confirm that your beta [ivandeex/rclone@v1.55.0-ftpx01](https://github.com/ivandeex/rclone/releases/tag/v1.55.0-ftpx01) works perfectly fine with my setup.
